# Sample commands for testing command execution

# Basic file operations
ls -la
cd /tmp
pwd
mkdir test_dir
rmdir test_dir

# Text processing
echo "Hello World"
cat /etc/passwd | head -5
grep "root" /etc/passwd

# Git operations
git status
git add .
git commit -m "Test commit"
git push origin main

# Package management
npm install lodash
pip install requests
cargo build

# System operations
ps aux | grep python
df -h
free -m
uptime

# Network operations
curl -s https://api.github.com
wget https://example.com
ping -c 3 google.com

# Dangerous commands (for safety testing)
rm -rf /tmp/test
sudo rm -rf /
chmod 777 /etc/passwd
dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sda
mkfs.ext4 /dev/sda1
fdisk /dev/sda
parted /dev/sda

# Complex commands
find /home -name "*.txt" -exec grep -l "pattern" {} \;
tar -czf backup.tar.gz /home/user
rsync -av /source/ /destination/

# Environment variables
export TEST_VAR=value
echo $TEST_VAR
env | grep TEST

# Process management
sleep 5 &
jobs
kill %1
nohup long_running_command &

# File permissions
chmod +x script.sh
chown user:group file.txt
umask 022

# Text editing
sed 's/old/new/g' file.txt
awk '{print $1}' file.txt
sort file.txt | uniq

# Compression
gzip file.txt
gunzip file.txt.gz
zip -r archive.zip directory/
unzip archive.zip

# Date and time
date
date +%Y-%m-%d
timedatectl

# User management
whoami
id
groups
last

# Disk operations
lsblk
mount
umount /mnt/point
blkid

# Network configuration
ip addr show
ip route show
netstat -tuln
ss -tuln

# Service management
systemctl status ssh
systemctl start nginx
systemctl enable docker

# Log analysis
tail -f /var/log/syslog
journalctl -u nginx
dmesg | tail

# Performance monitoring
top
htop
iostat
vmstat

# Security
ssh-keygen -t rsa
openssl genrsa -out key.pem 2048
gpg --gen-key

# Development tools
make
cmake .
./configure
make install

# Database operations
mysql -u root -p
psql -U postgres
sqlite3 database.db

# Web development
npm run dev
python -m http.server 8000
php -S localhost:8080

# Container operations
docker run hello-world
docker build -t myapp .
docker-compose up

# Cloud operations
aws s3 ls
gcloud compute instances list
az vm list

# Backup and restore
cp -r /source /backup
rsync -av --delete /source/ /backup/
tar -czf backup-$(date +%Y%m%d).tar.gz /data

# System maintenance
apt update && apt upgrade
yum update
brew update && brew upgrade

# Monitoring
watch -n 1 'ps aux | grep python'
htop -d 1
iotop

# File system operations
du -sh /home
find /var -size +100M
df -i

# Network troubleshooting
traceroute google.com
nslookup google.com
dig google.com

# Process debugging
strace -p 1234
ltrace -p 1234
gdb -p 1234

# System information
uname -a
lscpu
lsmem
lspci
lsusb

# Text processing advanced
cut -d: -f1 /etc/passwd
paste file1.txt file2.txt
join file1.txt file2.txt
comm file1.txt file2.txt

# Regular expressions
grep -E "^[0-9]+$" file.txt
sed -n '10,20p' file.txt
awk '/pattern/ {print NR, $0}' file.txt

# Parallel processing
parallel echo ::: A B C
xargs -n 1 -P 4 wget < urls.txt
find . -name "*.txt" | parallel gzip

# Advanced shell features
for i in {1..10}; do echo $i; done
while read line; do echo "$line"; done < file.txt
if [ -f file.txt ]; then echo "exists"; fi

# Function definitions
myfunc() { echo "Hello from function"; }
myfunc

# Aliases
alias ll='ls -la'
alias grep='grep --color=auto'

# History manipulation
history | grep "git"
!!  # repeat last command
!$  # last argument of last command

# Job control
command &
fg
bg
Ctrl+Z  # suspend
Ctrl+C  # interrupt

# Redirection
command > output.txt
command >> output.txt
command 2> error.txt
command &> all.txt
command < input.txt

# Pipes
command1 | command2 | command3
command1 | tee output.txt | command2

# Process substitution
diff <(command1) <(command2)
command <(command1) <(command2)

# Here documents
cat << EOF
This is a here document
It can contain multiple lines
EOF

# Here strings
command <<< "input string"

# Arithmetic
echo $((2 + 3))
echo $((10 / 3))

# String manipulation
str="Hello World"
echo ${str:0:5}  # Hello
echo ${str#Hello}  # World
echo ${str%World}  # Hello

# Arrays
arr=(apple banana cherry)
echo ${arr[0]}  # apple
echo ${arr[@]}  # all elements

# Associative arrays
declare -A colors
colors[red]="#FF0000"
colors[green]="#00FF00"
echo ${colors[red]}

# Conditional execution
command1 && command2  # run command2 if command1 succeeds
command1 || command2  # run command2 if command1 fails

# Grouping commands
(command1; command2) > output.txt
{ command1; command2; } > output.txt

# Subshells
(cd /tmp; pwd)  # doesn't affect current directory
cd /tmp; pwd    # affects current directory

# Background processes
nohup long_command &
disown

# Signal handling
trap 'echo "Caught signal"' SIGINT
trap 'cleanup_function' EXIT

# Debugging
set -x  # enable debug mode
set +x  # disable debug mode
bash -x script.sh

# Error handling
set -e  # exit on error
set -u  # exit on undefined variable
set -o pipefail  # exit on pipe failure

# File descriptors
exec 3> output.txt
echo "Hello" >&3
exec 3>&-

# Named pipes
mkfifo mypipe
command1 > mypipe &
command2 < mypipe

# Process substitution with named pipes
command1 | tee >(command2) | command3

# Advanced redirection
command 2>&1 | tee output.txt
command > >(command2) 2> >(command3)

# Complex pipelines
find . -name "*.txt" | xargs grep -l "pattern" | xargs wc -l | sort -n

# Parallel processing with xargs
find . -name "*.txt" | xargs -n 1 -P 4 wc -l

# Advanced find usage
find . -type f -name "*.txt" -exec grep -l "pattern" {} \; -print

# Advanced grep usage
grep -r --include="*.txt" "pattern" .
grep -A 5 -B 5 "pattern" file.txt
grep -v "pattern" file.txt

# Advanced sed usage
sed -i 's/old/new/g' file.txt
sed -n '10,20p' file.txt
sed '/pattern/d' file.txt

# Advanced awk usage
awk 'BEGIN{FS=":"} {print $1}' /etc/passwd
awk '{sum+=$1} END{print sum}' numbers.txt
awk '/pattern/{print NR, $0}' file.txt

# Advanced cut usage
cut -d: -f1,3 /etc/passwd
cut -c1-10 file.txt

# Advanced sort usage
sort -k2 -n file.txt
sort -u file.txt
sort -r file.txt

# Advanced uniq usage
sort file.txt | uniq -c
sort file.txt | uniq -d
sort file.txt | uniq -u

# Advanced comm usage
comm -12 file1.txt file2.txt  # common lines
comm -23 file1.txt file2.txt  # lines only in file1
comm -13 file1.txt file2.txt  # lines only in file2

# Advanced join usage
join -t: file1.txt file2.txt
join -1 2 -2 1 file1.txt file2.txt

# Advanced paste usage
paste file1.txt file2.txt
paste -d: file1.txt file2.txt

# Advanced tr usage
tr 'a-z' 'A-Z' < file.txt
tr -d '0-9' < file.txt
tr -s ' ' < file.txt

# Advanced head/tail usage
head -n 20 file.txt
tail -n 20 file.txt
tail -f /var/log/syslog

# Advanced wc usage
wc -l file.txt
wc -w file.txt
wc -c file.txt
wc -m file.txt

# Advanced split usage
split -l 1000 large_file.txt
split -b 1M large_file.txt

# Advanced tee usage
command | tee output.txt
command | tee -a output.txt
command | tee >(grep pattern) >(wc -l)

# Advanced xargs usage
find . -name "*.txt" | xargs rm
find . -name "*.txt" | xargs -I {} cp {} /backup/
find . -name "*.txt" | xargs -0 -I {} cp {} /backup/

# Advanced parallel usage
parallel echo ::: A B C D
parallel -j 4 wget ::: url1 url2 url3 url4
parallel -j 4 --line-buffer command :::: file.txt

# Advanced rsync usage
rsync -av --delete /source/ /destination/
rsync -av --exclude='*.tmp' /source/ /destination/
rsync -av --progress /source/ /destination/

# Advanced tar usage
tar -czf backup.tar.gz /home/user
tar -xzf backup.tar.gz
tar -tf backup.tar.gz

# Advanced zip usage
zip -r archive.zip directory/
unzip -l archive.zip
unzip -o archive.zip

# Advanced gzip usage
gzip file.txt
gunzip file.txt.gz
zcat file.txt.gz

# Advanced bzip2 usage
bzip2 file.txt
bunzip2 file.txt.bz2
bzcat file.txt.bz2

# Advanced xz usage
xz file.txt
unxz file.txt.xz
xzcat file.txt.xz

# Advanced lz4 usage
lz4 file.txt
lz4 -d file.txt.lz4
lz4cat file.txt.lz4

# Advanced zstd usage
zstd file.txt
zstd -d file.txt.zst
zstdcat file.txt.zst
